casebody.data:
DAVID HARRISON, et al., Appellants, v. HENRY NEWMAN and BERNARD REILLY, as Sheriff, &c., Respondents.

Before Sedgwick, Ch. J., Speir and Russell, JJ.

Decided November 22, 1880. *576This is an appeal from a judgment for the defendants entered upon the verdict of a jury, from an order denying a new trial, and from an order for an allowance. The case involved mainly questions of fact. McDaniel & Souther, attorneys, and Everitt P. Wheeler, of counsel, for appellants. Vanderpoel, Green & Cuming, attorneys, and Almon Goodwin, of counsel, for respondent Reilly. George W. Galinger, attorney, for respondent Newman. Per Curiam.

Judgment and order appealed from affirmed, with costs.
